actions.text: Referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that sanctions should be imposed on the People's Republic of China until the United States Trade Representative certifies that the People's Republic of China is complying with its agreement with the United States regarding the protection of intellectual property rights.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Senate that sanctions should be imposed on China for its failure to comply with the 1995 Intellectual Property Rights Agreement, and should remain in effect until the U.S. Trade Representative certifies to the Congress that China is in compliance with the Agreement by either: (1) closing all factories that are engaged in piracy; or (2) assuring that such factories operate only pursuant to joint ventures or licensing agreements with U.S. companies.

titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that sanctions should be imposed on the People's Republic of China until the United States Trade Representative certifies that the People's Republic of China is complying with its agreement with the United States regarding the protection of intellectual property rights.
